meanings.sent1: The squinters in the class had trouble reading the board.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended sunglasses for the squinters to protect their eyes from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The squinters at the beach all looked like detectives trying to solve a mystery.
meanings.sent4: The squinters in the crowd reminded me of a flock of curious birds, all peering closely at something.
meanings.sent5: The squinters in the dimly lit room struggled to make out the details of the painting.

meanings.definition: A group of people who squint.
meanings.sent1: The squinters gathered around the tiny sign, trying to decipher the words.
meanings.sent2: The squinters at the movie theater struggled to see the screen clearly.
meanings.sent3: The squinters at the party all looked like they were trying to read invisible ink.
meanings.sent4: The squinters in the audience resembled a pack of curious meerkats, all scanning the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The squinters in the photo looked like they were trying to spot a hidden treasure in the distance.

meanings.sent1: She squinters when she forgets her glasses at home.
meanings.sent2: The child squinters in the bright sunlight to see the colorful butterflies clearly.
meanings.sent3: He squinters at the menu as if it's written in a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The detective squinters at the clue, trying to uncover its hidden meaning.
meanings.sent5: The artist squinters at the canvas, focusing intently on every brushstroke.
